page.title: 01LANDSCAPE OF FORDYCE AREA
page.content: Our rural area is picturesque and peaceful with farms and crofts surrounded by burns and fir plantations. Farming is mixed, crops being mainly of barley, grass for grazing, turnips and potatoes. Cattle, sheep and pigs are reared and poultry farming is plentiful. Some older farm houses are being used as holiday homes, while others, being unoccupied for some years, are now in ruins. In the village itself, places of great historic interest are to be found and this has led to Fordyce being made a conservation area. The residents take a great deal of pride in their area and try to maintain the standard they achieved in l984, when their efforts were highly commended in the magazine "Scotland in Bloom."
